Now it's official: I get the Laureus prize for charity. This fills me with great pride, gratitude, and I see it as an inducement. Even before the World Cup weÂ´ve talked about what could i do, that would be sustainable in Brazil. Friends made me aware of the good work of BigShoe at that time. This organization gives children a normal life by doing successful surgeries. Therefore we decided to help in my name eleven children with surgeries before the World Cup. My â€Eleven" - the best team in the world. My team. After the World Cup I increased the number of surgeries to 23 - also because we had 23 players in the      DFB-Team. WeÂ´ve chosen children with cleft lip and deformities for the surgeries. Now I get this award from Laureus Sport for Good Stiftung on Wednesday for my total commitment this year - and I accept it as well in the name of the medicals and Bigshoe workers. And as well of other volunteers who are committed to help disadvantaged children all over the world. Let us keep up the good work to help these children. #LaureusSportforGood #Bigshoe

Schon vor der WM haben wir darÃ¼ber gesprochen: Was kann man machen, dass in Brasilien etwas Nachhaltiges bleibt. Freunde haben mich damals auf die gute Arbeit von Bigshoe aufmerksam gemacht. Artik resmi: Sosyal yardim dalinda Laureus odulunu aldim. Bu benim icin cok ozel ve cok buyuk bir onur. Dunya Kupasi oncesinde Brezilya icin neler yapabiliriz uzerine cok konusmustuk. BigShoe organizasyonundan arkadaslarim beni haberdar etti. Bu organizasyon basarili ameliyatlar yaparak ihtiyaci olan cocuklara normal bir hayat yasamalarina imkan veriyor. Benim adima 11 cocuga Dunya Kupasi oncesi ameliyatlari konusunda yardim etme karari aldik. Benim "onbirim" dunyanin en iyi takimi! DK sonrasi cocuk sayisini 23e yukselttik cunku Alman Milli Takiminda 23oyuncuyduk. Laureus Odulunu Carsamba gunu alacagim. Bu odulu bize cok buyuk yardimlari olan saglik ekibi ve BigShoe calisanlari adina ve engelli tum cocuklara yardim icin calisan herkes adina aliyorum. Cocuklara yardim edelim.
